meanings.definition: The movement of an organism or cell in response to a chemical stimulus.
meanings.sent1: The chemotaxes of the amoeba towards the sugar was fascinating to observe.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the chemotaxes of bacteria towards nutrients in the environment.
meanings.sent3: The chemotaxes of the ants towards the spilled sugar created a tiny parade.
meanings.sent4: The chemotaxes of the cells towards the signaling molecule resembled a synchronized dance.
meanings.sent5: The chemotaxes of the fish towards the bait was like a magnet pulling them in.

meanings.definition: The orientation or movement of an organism or cell in response to a chemical gradient.
meanings.sent1: The chemotaxes of the plant roots towards water helped them grow towards it.
meanings.sent2: The amoeba's chemotaxes guided it towards higher concentrations of food.
meanings.sent3: The chemotaxes of the bacteria towards the chemical gradient looked like a coordinated march.
meanings.sent4: The chemotaxes of the cells towards the attractant formed a beautiful pattern.
meanings.sent5: The chemotaxes of the organism towards the scent trail was like following a map.
